meanings.sent1: The wound was slowly gangrening, turning black and emitting a foul smell.
meanings.sent2: If left untreated, the infection can lead to gangrening of the tissue.
meanings.sent3: The neglected fruit in the fridge was gangrening so much, it seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The corruption in the city was gangrening society, spreading its decay to every corner.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood as a haunting reminder of the gangrening neglect of the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The lack of blood flow can gangren the tissue, leading to serious complications.
meanings.sent2: In severe cases, frostbite can gangren the extremities if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent3: The careless chef's mistake gangrened the entire batch of soup, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The toxic waste from the factory gangrened the river, causing harm to the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The spread of misinformation can gangren society, eroding trust and unity.
